Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 7e9093e625961f533250a6c193c1a474e98007c4
It also makes Request& req non-const for no reason that I can see or understand.  Please mention that here along with the reasoning.
Ooh yes.. i missed that. will add it here
Updated commit message for the same

This looks wrong, but I don't understand why you did it.  At this context I would've expected request to be const.  The request is complete at this point, and only needs handled.  It shouldn't be modified after this point.

The reason i lifted off const here was because we have to assign "req.userRole = userRole;"

Its only for this call that the const is removed. It is being retained in other places where changes are not permitted/required.

> The reason i lifted off const here was because we have to assign "req.userRole = userRole;"

ACK.

> 
> Its only for this call that the const is removed. It is being retained in other places where changes are not permitted/required.
Done
This has lifetime issues.

Yeah, till the d-bus call finishes, authorization check completes inside call back, Its alive.

As said below, May be caching the user data locally to bmcweb will improve the performance and reduce the connection keep alive issue. But this commit adds authorization check for upgrade routes and  bring both (normal & upgrade) routes on to same page.

> Yeah, till the d-bus call finishes, authorization check completes inside call back, Its alive.

But, it's not.  If the connection drops, it's no longer alive.  With that said, this is no worse than what we have today.

> 
> As said below, May be caching the user data locally to bmcweb will improve the performance and reduce the connection keep alive issue.

+1.  Please review my patches for this.

> But this commit adds authorization check for upgrade routes and  bring both (normal & upgrade) routes on to same page.
This code looks copied and pasted from somewhere.
Yes.. its a direct liftoff from handle() section below. Line 1434 onwards.
Dheeraj, We can  move all this common code to single API and use it both places.
Moved the common code to a new function (validatePrivilege).
This is doing a blocking dbus call for EVERY request.  That's unacceptable for performance.

This could be a performance issue in case of handle() section below which gets called for each query to an URI.
Here is it only called during upgraded connections.. i.e. either for Websockets or SSE sockets.. which is  only once to establish the connection. and once it is done, it wouldn't be checking this part right.

So, i feel it shouldn't be much of a bottle neck here in case of handleUpgrade().

Yeah Agree with Ed, This is blocking call and will impact the overall performance. 

But this d-bus call is made only when establishing websocket connection ( one time). So this won't introduce much latency. Also Same problem exist even for Normal route handler() (https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/http/routing.hpp#L1405-L1407).

I believe this can be avoided by caching the information on bmcweb side. So I think we can do it as separate commit to address generic issue.
Done.  This is no worse than what we have.  But definitely needs fixed.
Some minor changes, but this is looking much better.  I'm guessing it can merge soon.
use sdbusplus::unpackPropertiesNoThrow instead of this loop
Done
Possible nullptr dereference.  Pass by reference maybe?
Done
This is far too long to be a lambda on its own.  Please put this into its own function.

bind_front was throwing some errors coz of templated functions.
Handled it differently by moving majority of code to a separate function and keeping the Lambda short
Why was this copied?  Websockets don't need to return an allow header, and don't really have a verb, so an allow header doesn't make sense.
Section Removed
I also wonder why this change was made.
It was picked up by mistake. Reverted
This shouldnt' be a lambda either.  Use a normal function with bind_front

I see that only a Try catch block is here and no major code is present here.
It just appears lengthy as the Error Logs are being wrapped into multiple lines.
Otherwise it is a very tiny snippet of code
Done
inline keyword here, not static.

ACK !
Will add this change
This code is just moved from the old code.  Lets do code updates in a different commit from moves.
Ack

Your logs are incorrect. unpackPropertiesNotThrow ensures that if property is present it has correct type. So if your code reach this place you can be 100% sure that "RemoteUser" property was missing.
Again, this was in the old code.  Lets do code moves in a different commit from changes.
Ack
unpackPropertiesNotThrow ensures type is correct. If passwordExpired is nullptr it means that it was missing. Otherwise unpackPropertiesNotThrow would return false.
Same again.
Ack
NIT: Not specific to this commit, This is existing code. But do you know why we are altering the user privilege information.  Clarification only.
I'm not sure what you mean by altering.  can you clarify?
a
ACK

If the req.session->username is not found in xyz.openbmc_project.User.Manager, Then D-BUS will through the error right. So, this should NOT be internal error. It should be user not found (Authentication failure).

Ack
Will add this change
Per asio conventions, callbacks should always be called when the operation is completed.

Noted.
Will make this change.
If rule is not found, lets log the error message with URL information for better debugging.

Ack
Will add the necessary log
One bug which need fix, Other code lgtm.
NIT: First check error conditions before assigning the userRole. Move this code block to 1294.
This wasn't changed in this patch.  Please submit to a patchset where this was changed.
Done
This was copied from below.

No longer in this patchset.   Please comment on
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61616

UnpackPropertiesNoThrow verifies type of the variable. If property had wrong type it will return false and UnpackErrorPrinter will print proper information. So in this log and one below it is only possible to have RemoteUser missing.

You should change log message to "RemoteUser property missing."

No longer in this patchset, please comment on

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61616

For non-local user ( Where passwordExpired  is not present on d-Bus), You must set it to false before proceeding further, because this is used in 1302 line and where if passwordExpired nullptr, That will lead to crash.
Done

Above is check for nullptr without return.
This line can dereference nullptr.
No longer in this patchset.
it is advised to catch exceptions by const&, it helps compiler with some optimizations

Catch has been removed in https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61617

It is no longer required, and didn't make much sense.
I split up the method breakout into its own patch so this could be better reviewed as to differences, and we werent calling out code that was already on master (even if it uses old structures).
Reviewers and testers.  I've reworked this patch series into a bunch of smaller ones, which makes this much easier to review, and much easier to verify the correctness of.
Please retest, and review the series.
code lgtm
Looks good to me.
